results.title: DreamWorks Animation Masterclass: Doug Cooper
results.creator_credit: Jesse Taylorsmith, Shelley Matulick, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
At the heart of DreamWorks Animation is the desire to tell great stories and inspire audiences.

In a series of masterclass sessions, the creative team behind the studio that brought us ‘Kung Fu Panda’, ‘Shrek’ and ‘Madagascar’, gave an exclusive look inside the professional animation industry.

Doug Cooper (VFX Supervisor) joined DreamWorks in 1998 as a CG Effects Animator and Technical Director on ‘The Prince of Egypt’ and went on to serve as the Digital Supervisor on ‘Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron’. Previous credits as VFX supervisor include ‘Bee Movie’ and ‘First Flight’ (an animated short).

results.title: Glen Keane interview with Emma McRae [excerpt]
results.brief_description: Glen Keane has been with the Walt Disney Studios for over 25 years and is best known for his character animations for feature films such as: ‘The Little Mermaid’, ‘Aladdin’, ‘Beauty and the Beast’, ‘Tarzan’, and ‘Tangled’. In this interview, Emma McRae, ACMI Exhibitions Curator, speaks to Glen about his never-ending passion for drawing, what inspires him to create such unforgettable characters as The Beast and Ariel. Glen also talks about the changes in animation from hand drawn to digital.

results.brief_description: Lella Smith is the Creative Director of the Walt Disney Animation and Research Library and curator of the ‘Dreams Come True: The Art of Disney’s Classic Fairytales’ exhibition. In this interview, Emma McRae, ACMI Exhibitions Curator, speaks to Lella about how the exhibition came about and the enormous task of selecting the films and items for exhibition from Disney’s vast archives.

results.title: Dreams come true: interviews with Glen Keane and Lella Smith
results.brief_description: ACMI curator, Emma McRae interviews Glen Keane and Lella Smith as part of the ‘Disney : dreams come true’ exhibition at ACMI. Glen Keane is an animator for Disney and has created some of the recent best-loved characters such as Ariel from ‘The Little mermaid’ and ‘The Beast’ from ‘Beauty and the beast’. Lella Smith is the creative director of Disney’s Animation Research Library and was a curator for the ‘Disney : dreams come true’ exhibition. These interviews were recorded at ACMI in conjunction with the opening of the exhibition.

results.title: Dreams of return
results.creator_credit: Michael Buckley, Timorese Association of Victoria, North Richmond Community Health Centre and Julie Shiels
results.brief_description: This CDROM has been funded by the Australian Film Commission and is primarily about the experiences of Timorese refugees living in Australia. The work is a contemporary look at identity, resistance and the dream of return to East Timor. The CDROM is shaped around the performance and cultural work (including dance, drumming and storytelling) developed by members of the East Timorese community who are based at the North Richmond community health centre. The work in this CDROM was developed in conjunction with the Timorese association of Victoria.

results.title: Our house
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “A History of British art”.
Episode six of ‘A History of British art’ looks at the movement of modernism - Dada, Surrealism and Expressionism, and the misconception that the movement passed British art by. Written and presented by Andrew Graham-Dixon.
